snippet.title: Russian social media CEO quits, flees country
snippet.description: The founder of Russia's leading social media network - a wunderkind often described as Russia's Mark Zuckerberg - has left his post as CEO and fled the country as cronies of President Vladimir Putin have made steady inroads into the company's ownership.

snippet.title: 8 overlooked Civil War moments from 1864 that could have changed history
snippet.description: Eight experts share little known but significant moments that affected the course of history.

snippet.title: U.S. Grant was the great hero of the Civil War but lost favor with historians
snippet.description: A general little honored today was, with Lincoln, the man who saved the Union.

snippet.title: Vermont ups the ante on genetically modified foods
snippet.description: Vermont has raised the stakes in the debate over genetically modified foods by becoming the first state to pass a bill requiring that they be labeled as such in the grocery aisle, making the move despite the opposition of the powerful U.S. food industry.

snippet.title: Q&A with Dorothy Brinton Parker, Andrew Wyeth's model and friend
snippet.description: Parker modeled numerous times for Andrew Wyeth, including during the summer when the "Helga Pictures" became public.

snippet.title: After Spotsylvania, Grant and Lee waged relentlesswarfare through Virginia
snippet.description: For sustained, frightful fighting at close quarters in horrible conditions, Spotsylvania may be unsurpassed.

snippet.title: Poll: Support for Medicaid expansion down sharply in Virginia
snippet.description: A Christopher Newport University survey finds Virginians are souring on McAuliffe's top priority.

snippet.title: Civil War 150: Cast of supporting characters
AP sources: Work to free US soldier disorganized
snippet.description: Critics of the U.S. government's nearly five-year effort to seek the release of the only American soldier held captive in Afghanistan claim the work suffers from disorganization and poor communication among numerous federal agencies involved, leaving his captors unclear which U.S. officials have the authority to make a deal.

snippet.title: Bronze statue of Roger Ebert unveiled at Ebertfest
snippet.description: Roger Ebert's final blog posting last April ended with his hopeful sign-off: "I'll see you at the movies." The award-winning film critic died two days later.
